name: Hotel de l'Horloge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent five nights in the De l'Horloge Hotel. It is extremely well situated and the facilities are perfectly adequate for a 3 star French hotel. However, we had booked a 'superior' room and I have to say it was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. There did appear to be much bigger rooms in the hotel so I would recommend that anyone planning a stay in this hotel asks about the size of the room before confirming their booking.
reviews.title: Small room at the De l'Horloge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this sight I decided to book at the L'horloge and was really glad I did. It was definately one of the best hotels (in its price class) that I've stayed at in Europe. The location was perfect, reception was warm and helpful, the room was clean and modern and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was included in the rate we found and it was a pleasnt euro-style breakfast in a cheerful dining room. But had it not been included--I probably would have skipped it and just grab something at a cafe. If I ever come back to Avignon, I will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

likes.liked: — location and that the rooms were clean and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: Just returned from a delightful stay at the Hotel de l'Horloge in Avignon. The rooms look freshly done, are very clean, and the location is perfect. The thin walls are the only downside -- you can hear everything in the rooms next door and in the hallway (not good for taking an afternoon nap upon arrival, with the cleaning staff conversing loudly in the hallway). However, the staff is very helpful. I also left my unlocked bag there over a few days and found it intact upon my return (though I had not left anything of value in it). As for food, I heard the breakfast buffet is good, but it's expensive. There are many cafes just steps away that have more reasonable continental breakfast options. One note of caution: if you need an early morning taxi to get to the TGV station or elsewhere, ensure that it is arranged the night before. Even though I did this, my taxi did not show up at 5:15am as promised for my 6:00am train. Even after repeated calls from the front desk, it didn't arrive until 5:45. I made the train, but it was too close for my comfort.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just come back from 5 days in Avignon, staying at the Hotel De l'Horlage. Overall a very pleasant stay. We booked through Eurostar for a very reasonable all-in price for travel and room only hotel, and chose the Horlage because of its perfect position.
reviews.title: Location,Location,Location
Nice weekend stay
reviews.text: As others have said, very helpful staff fluent in English. Our room was on the small side, but OK. The location is unbeatable - steps to restaurants, the Pont, and the Palais des Papes. There are several excellent art galleries, and we spent an enjoyable day in Villeneuve across the river. It's an easy bus journey on the number 11.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a Great Location
reviews.text: We only had the pleasure of spending 2 nights in this lovely hotel. The location of the hotel is superb, just off a side street from the towns square and also beside the Pope's Palace. We stayed in one of the hotel's superior rooms, which for the price I wasn't expecting it to be near as nice as it was. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable with a view which was overlooking the square. The staff were extremely friendly and incredibly helpful making the hotel feel homely. We very much enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved this hotel for our 3-night stay in Avignon because of the reviews it received on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. We had a 4th floor corner room, so our double became a triple for the two of us, and we couldn't have been more pleased with the room, its location, and how much space we had. Our room was spotlessly clean every day. There was plenty of storage: an armoire and a closet as well as plenty of room for our suitcases to lay open. The desk clerks were outstanding: warm, polite, and helpful. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: A Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel. Our room overlooked the tiled roofs of Avignon, which only added to the ambiance of this lovely little town. The bed was comfortable and bath was very large. The sage infused soaps and body wash are wonderful and you can purchase them at the front desk to take home with you. The breakfast room is located next to the hotel and has a very nice atrium to dine in. Breakfast was outstanding! The central location is ideal for walking the Popes Palace and the Pont Saint-Benezet. The cafés are literally at your doorstep. Sebastian at the concierge desk was more than gracious and helped me retrieve a left behind passport which was then forwarded to our hotel in Nice, for that was our last stop. His kindness and compassion absolutely added to our excellent experience here in Avignon and put us at ease so we could enjoy the rest of our vacation.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel in early September.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel has mxed quality rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As previous reviews state, this hotel is in an excellent location in the centre of everything right on a very nice square and only a short stroll to the main attraction such as the Pope's Palace and the famous bridge.
reviews.title: Terrific

likes.liked: — Right in the heart of the old city and steeped in history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally I think the management of this hotel need a wake up call themselves. It's not bad at all. The location is excellent and the building has charm. But it's starting to look a bit tatty. The photo on the website is blatantly deceptive - our room had stained carpets, tired furniture and was TINY (barely bigger than the double bed). Worst of all was the air conditioning which sounded like a helicopter taking off. When we complained the receptionist very patronizingly told me to turn it down to the lowest setting. This is not acceptable. It was the height of summer, so sort it out! Your rates are not cheap, after all. After we'd moaned about this the receptionist was snooty and aloof with us. Not a good sign. It doesn't cost anything to make people feel welcome.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — the poor service and general shabbiness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, right on Place D'Horloge and 2 minutes from the Palais. But, the hotel itself is really average...maybe even a bit below average. The redeeming benefit of our room was a small balcony/deck that overlooked the rooftops of Avignon. Otherwise, the room was tiny and shabby. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived in the late afternoon, but the staff was apologetic and sent us to their bar/restaurant for a drink until it was ready about 20 minutes later. The front desk staffer who checked us out was extremely rude and unhelpful.
reviews.title: Just OK, but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the heart of Avignon, so very convenient but also loud.
reviews.title: Would not stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: As they didn't have the room we booked, they upgraded us to a Superior room... don't know, how it earned the word Superior.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room size was okay but everything dated. Dark brown carpet, old beds and old furniture. The a/c did work so bad, that there was no difference to the outside, also it was in the middle of August. Really bad smell in the room. Bad lighting. Only one bedside table.
reviews.title: Good place and friendly staff

likes.liked: — staff, location, service, it was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel on our arrival in Avignon. We appreciated the late check-in and the friendly welcome, right in the centre of Avignon old town.
reviews.title: OK hotel in a good location, poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place! Fabulous location - this hotel is right in the main square. Nice staff and clean and well furnished rooms with great views. Avignon is a nightmare to park but the hotel has a special rate at a bargain Eu5.50 per night in the main underground carpark a 5 minute trundle away with your cases. Everything is on your doorstep here. Stop messing about - just book it!
reviews.title: Stop looking around - book this hotel!

likes.disliked: — Rooms a little small but in that location just get out and see Avignon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off... this was a FABULOUS hotel. From the beginning our experience was great. Prior to arrival, we corresponded via email, to get a room with a terrace. Upon arrival, the lift was out of service so we were offered a choice of rooms (ours was on the top / 5th floor) . We opted for the original terrace room and the receptionist insisted on carrying our bags up the steps to the room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was exceptionally large for a typical European hotel. We had a comfortable king size bed, satellite TV, a couple chairs and a coffee bar in the room. The bathroom looked as if it had recently been renovated and was large and clean. The toilet was set off from the sink / tub area in a seperate small room. There was no shower curtain, however, the jovial receptionist said "go ahead and make a swimming pool.. you are on vacation!" A safe deposit box was available at no extra charge in the lobby / reception area.
reviews.title: It is the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Terrace was more like a large rooftop patio with comfortable chairs and great views of the famous clock tower and the Palais de Papes. The terrace had high walls which blocked the wind and provided a great deal of privacy. The location of the hotel was superb, directly on the Place de Horloge. The Palais de Papes was only a few hundred meters from the front door and there were countless shops, cafes and resturants in the immediate and surrounding area.
reviews.title: Location is unbelievable

likes.disliked: — multiple floors with stairs in many directions--its an old building so expected it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was abundantly available at the Palais de Papes underground garage for about 5 Euro with the hotel discount. Overall, this hotel was superb and a great deal considering the cleanliness and location as well as the price (110 Euro / night with terrace). Next time we are in Avignon, we will definately come back to the L'Horloge!
reviews.title: Location, location, location

likes.disliked: — A/C seemed inadequate, and we could not get it cool enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: A group of us booked this hotel unseen and were delighted immediately by its location-an easy walk from the railway station-and right on the Town Square. It is close to the major sights: le Pont d'Avignon and the Palais du Papes. Our rooms were spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. The staff were attentive and very helpful. They resolved issues with a restaurant, in which they were not directly involved and were at all times completely professional. The breakfast room was a delight and the fare offered, excellent. I can't say too many good things about this place!
reviews.title: Only place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I were just there at the end of May and thought it was very nice. It’s close to everything in the area!! The rooms were your standard small rooms and it was extremely clean. The bed was also very comfy. The Staff was nice and helpful. They seem to have an answer to all of our questions. Breakfast was also included in our price (Not sure if it is for everyone), but we thought it was delicious and filling. They served assorted breads, cereals, yogurts, meats, cheeses, eggs, bacon, coffee, hot coco and juices.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: If we were to go back to Avignon, I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend this June and it was excellent. It was clean, friendly and comfortable. We had a small terrace with a view over the town and couldn't have been more centrally located.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not know how this hotel justifies being rated 5th in Avignon. We reserved a twin room many months ago - price E148. During the next few months we received an e-mail asking us for a non-returnable deposit of E180 if cancelled after the 31st May - something to do with the Avignon Festival. At this point it was difficult to find another hotel, so we paid up and another which increased the price to E158 - which I refused to pay. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded from a Superior Room to a Prestige Room. It had a double bed and a single bed. The single bed was only fit for a child and there was no headboard, side table or lamp. We soon found out that having a room overlooking the Place l'Horlogue was not good news if the airconditioning did not work - which it did not. For 3 nights we hardly slept a wink - we had to choose whether to leave the windows open to get some air - in which case we suffered the horrendous noise from outside which was followed in the early morning by the engine noises of the street cleaning brigade - or keeping the windows closed and suffocating as the air-conditioning did not work properly and made a loud noise! On our second day we rose to find that there was no hot water until late afternoon and on our third day we went back to our room to have a rest at about 3.30 in the afternoon and found that our room had not been made up. We had to wait until 4.30 for this to be done.
reviews.title: What a dump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is part of a group of 3 and we never saw a Manager the whole time we were there. The place is very tired, with no facilities - no lounge, no bar and the breakfast is E14. I felt very nervous whilst we were there as it is a warren with many steps all over the place. To reach our room we had to go down 7 steps along various passages - up 2 more steps - I wondered how we would have coped in the event of a fire. There are no fire escape diagrams in the rooms.
reviews.title: Just ok, not that great

likes.disliked: — Old, awful bed, out of date

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, my husband had to negotiate a reduction on leaving - but it still wasn't worth it. I notice that many people rate this hotel because of its convenient location but quite frankly Avignon is not that big and all hotels within the walls are conveniently located.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fortunately, we only booked for 4 nights and then moved across the river to Villeneuve les Avignon and stayed at the Hotel Magnaneraie. What a difference! Great room with balcony overlooking the wonderful garden - aircon worked! Large pool area. Beautiful restaurant in a garden setting. Free parking. Terrific service.
reviews.title: Great Location/Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice to anyone is, unless you can afford the best, stay in Villeneuve les Avignon. It is only 5 minutes in the car, or there is a bus service. In the summer Villeneuve is an oasis after steaming Avignon. There are some very good restaurants - particularly the Jardin du Livrees which has serious cooking and a 3 course menu only costs E24 with dining on the terrace in a peaceful setting.There are some interesting sights too.
reviews.title: Good room, noisy surroundings

description: HOTEL OF CHARACTER...In a fine stone building of the XIX century, the Hotel de l’Horloge proposes 66 enjoyable rooms highlighted with warm colours of the region. Certain have terraces offering a panoramic view over the Popes Palace and the surrounding countryside.AVIGNON, HISTORY AND CULTUREIn the heart of this historical city, just a few steps away from the prestigious Popes Palace and International Conference Center, the Hotel de l’Horloge opens its doors onto the “Place de l’Horloge” renowned for its restaurants, cafés, and shaded terraces.
